intro: Gyrostachys camporum, commonly known as the Camp's gyrostachys, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Gyrostachys camporum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
